phrases: Grade 1, Class 3 Nana Komatsu
Grade 1, Class 3 Nana Komatsu I am straying from the subject, but please bear with me.
Grade 1, Class 3 Nana Komatsu
Ever since I was a child,
my dream was to become a beautiful bride.
There was really nothing else that I truly wanted to be.
When I was darkness at that time
With trembling lips
The more I struggle
The more this wound deepens
The broken promise hurt me
Nobody can save me
God, I have only one request
Stop tearing apart my love
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Sorrow tumbling down is your song
All alone with nowhere to go in my life
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Oh baby, help me from frozen pain
With your smile, your eyes, and sing me, just for me
I want to need your love
I am a broken rose
I want to need your love
Wedding funds?!
That is right.
Listen, a wedding is a major event, so it is going to cost money.
So a bit at a time, I had saved money for that special day.
It is not easy for a parent with three daughters, you know.
So why are you suddenly depositing such important funds
into my account?
Well, you eloped, did not you?
Huh?!
I am home.
Hey, Nami.
- Where have you been - Mom.
- until this hour?
- Mom!
I was at, like, a karaoke bar.
- Come on! - Mom!
Cannot you at least call
- if you are going to be late?!
- Mom!
Hello, Nana?
Mom, what makes you think I eloped?!
Hello, Sis?
Nami?
How are you?
How is life in Tokyo treating you?
How are things with your boyfriend?
Nami!
It is you, is not it?
You are the one giving Mom strange ideas, are not you?
What?
Not really.
All I said was you had gone to Tokyo to live with a guy.
You are wrong!
There is no need to hide it.
I envy you.
You get to have sex every day, right?
Goodness, will you watch what you say?
Go on and take a bath.
Huh?
But I want to talk some more.
- Y-Young women - I took a bath already.
- today will - Where?
- talk about s-sex - That hurt!
- in front of their parents? - You kicked me!
Hello, Nana?
- Anyway, you are legally an adult now, - This sucks.
I should have
- so do whatever you wish - applied to a university
- with that money.
- in Tokyo, too.
Just do not get divorced and come running home.
D-Divorced?!
Do not because me any more trouble than you already have.
Bye.
Mom?
This is no laughing matter!
I thought she would ask me to return home
because she was worried or something.
But do not come running home?
Would a parent say that?
I am not even married yet!
Way to go, Natsuko!
What a cool mother!
Are you drunk, Nana?
No, I am not drunk.
Why even ask?
I am back.
I bought you cigarettes, Nana.
You have had a few, I see.
I love you!
I get it.
So do not jump on me.
Wh-What about Nobu and Shin?
Yeah.
Nobu passed out on the sidewalk, so Shin took him home.
I-I see.
Nobu was drinking a lot, after all.
That Shin.
Surprisingly, he just does not get drunk.
Is it only water to him?
Do not fall asleep.
Give me a break.
Come on, Nana.
It is the first time I saw Nana with her guard down and drunk like that.
She is kind of cute.
She must be really happy that Yasu has come.
She even kissed him in the mix of things.
And on top of that, telling him I love you?
But it was not as if Yasu was at all surprised by it.
Those two could be dating, after all.
What are they doing with the door open?
Oh, sorry, Nana.
Having you clean up all by yourself.
Let me help you.
It is okay.
I just have to rinse.
Then give me a towel.
I will wipe the dishes.
Yasu is a great guy.
He does not look it, but he is kind, considerate, and reliable,
but does not brag.
And he is a lawyer too.
If I were to marry someone, I would prefer a guy like him.
What am I thinking?
Yasu belongs to Nana.
Come to think of it, I have Shoji.
Oh, are you done?
Thanks for doing the dishes.
I will be on my way.
Huh?
Thanks for the meal.
Where are you going?
I think I will stay in a hotel until I find my own place.
Shin's at Nobu's place so it is kind of crowded there.
Why not stay here?
Right.
Thank you.
But I will hafta decline the offer.
There is no reason you should hafta decline!
Yeah, but it would not be right.
Good night.
Why?
I do not understand.
Although she was drunk, Nana was being so sweet.
Why is Yasu always so stoic?
Could he have a girlfriend back home?
Playing in a band and all, he is probably popular with the women.
Still, even if he does have a girlfriend back home
she cannot be that important to him since he left her to come here.
Shoji left me, too!
But it is not the same with Shoji.
He is treated me with great care since long ago.
Besides, I am here now because he asked me to come.
I decided on my own to go after him and come here!
Well, you eloped, did not you?
Just do not get divorced and come running home.
You are wrong, Mom.
I came here on my own.
Let us live together, Nana.
It is all right.
It is all right.
Shoji said that to me.
If I wanted to marry,
he would accept me as his bride anytime.
I wonder.
Living together and getting married is somewhat different, I think.
Besides, Shoji just started studying at the university,
so he will not graduate for another four years.
And he is just as broke as I am.
A wedding is a major event, so it is going to cost money.
She is right.
I am not interested in a cheap wedding.
I want to wear a traditional white wedding kimono.
She is right.
I am not interested in a cheap wedding.
I want to wear a traditional white wedding kimono.
I have got to wear cute bridal wear.
I have got to wear cute bridal wear.
And a wedding dress.
I have got to wear cute bridal wear.
I do not want to live in low-income housing
or a one bedroom apartment.
If possible, a detached home with a yard would be nice.
Or at least, a brand new condominium.
I hafta save money!
I will try not to use the 300,000 yen my mom sent me,
and keep it in my bank account.
And I will save more on my own, too.
If I keep at it, I should have saved up quite an amount
by the time Shoji graduates from university.
Shoji!
I will get that house with a yard, Shoji.
Leave it to me.
Fantasy running wild I will get that house with a yard, Shoji.
Leave it to me.
My head hurts!
Shit.
I should not have agreed to work today.
Hachi!
Medicine!
Hachi!
Are not you home?!
Oh, good morning, Nana.
What is with that outfit?
I have a job interview.
I gave them a call and they told me to come right away.
How do I look?
Will this do?
Work?
What kind?
A publisher.
What?!
Are you all right?
Do you have a hangover, Nana?
I have got some medicine that will work for that.
A publisher?
Can someone like you get into a place like that?
But I do meet their conditions to apply.
The ad says they are looking for someone who can do errands.
Besides, it is a small company I have never heard of,
so I am sure it will be fine.
You sure about that?
I just hope this place is not going bankrupt anytime soon.
Let me get you some water.
Let me get you, she says.
She is even changed her speech pattern to match the outfit.
But why a publisher, suddenly?
I just happened to come across it in the classifieds.
The salary's good and I get two days off every week.
Also, since I am living in Tokyo,
I would like to commute to the downtown.
Does not working for a publisher sound super cool?
It has the ring of a successful woman.
Ring of a successful woman?
But I am glad you have decided to look for your next job.
I thought you saying you wanted to live on your own
was all talk and no action.
But now I see you were serious.
Well, not really.
The only reason I decided to work is simply because I want money.
But regardless of what my true intentions are,
if I get into a sound company and work hard,
it will eventually give me the skills and ability to live on my own.
That is killing two birds with one stone.
By the way, where is Yasu?
Yasu said he will be staying at a hotel until he finds a place to live, and left.
I tried to stop him, but...
Is that so.
Is that so?!
I will be going now.
We will be practicing at the usual studio tonight.
Can you make it too, Hachi?
Mhm.
I have no plans this evening.
Then come!
From tonight, Yasu will be playing the drums,
so it is going to be far better than anything you have heard so far.
Sure!
That Nana.
She really is in a good mood.
Her good mood is rubbing off on me, it is making me excited.
But yeah.
They now have all the band members they need.
All they have to do now is head towards their dreams full force.
All right!
I will do my best, too!
Shoji!
Hey, Junko!
Long time no see.
Well, yeah.
It is the first time I have run into you on campus.
Are you coming to school like you should?
That is not nice.
I am seriously attending classes.
Shoji.
I will go on ahead.
Should I cover for you?
Ah, sure.
Well... no.
Which is it?!
Make up your mind, will ya?!
Use your wise judgment!
All right.
So is that the rumored Sachiko?
No!
Ah, what is this about a rumor?!
What the hell?!
No!
Ah, what is this about a rumor?!
No!
Ah, what is this about a rumor?!
Wow.
You are totally freaking out.
That makes you all the more suspicious.
Give me a break!
That Kyosuke.
Telling Junko, of all people...
Let that guy speaking in a Kansai dialect cover for you in class.
In the meantime, you will give me details.
Matsuda.
Have you seen Shoji today?
Is he not here?
No.
We were together until a moment ago.
But we bumped into a girl he knew.
They wanted to talk, so I left.
Oh?
It is not like that.
I doubt that was his girlfriend.
Do not worry.
Matsuda.
I do not have special feelings for Shoji.
We are just good friends.
What are you saying?
It is more than obvious.
You know, at first I thought you two were dating.
I was really surprised when I heard that Shoji has another girlfriend.
I did not know either until recently.
To be honest I was a bit surprised.
What do you mean?!
Was he hiding it?!
He is the worst!
That is not it!
I assumed on my own that he did not have one!
Do not cover for him.
You are so sweet.
Come on, have a seat, Sachiko.
Forget about Shoji and go out with me.
Sorry, but I am not attending this class.
Besides, you have a girlfriend back home, do not you, Matsuda?
Shoji told me.
That guy.
Going around disclosing other people's secrets and not his.
I will get you for this, Shoji.
You really are the worst!
I have totally lost respect for you!
I just did not get a chance to talk about it.
I was not necessarily hiding it.
Do not make excuses!
You were planning on two-timing them, were not you?
Junko!
Do you think I am capable of doing something like that?!
Of course not!
Yet you got greedy and ended up breaking somebody is heart.
You think she is hurt.
Of course she is hurt!
Sachiko's in love with you, right?
But maybe I am just hoping that she is.
She has not actually told me that she likes me.
And nothing has changed since.
We still continue seeing each other as no more than friends.
Your intellectual level has remained the same since junior high.
This is nonsense!
Junko!
Do not talk to me like that!
What should I do to make things right?!
You hafta put an end to this.
If you keep spending time with her,
you will continue hurting her until it becomes unbearable.
But we attend the same classes and we work at the same workplace.
Actually, before you concern yourself with Sachiko,
should not you be thinking about Nana instead?
Huh?
So Sachiko's more important to you than Nana.
That is not true!
I have not done anything that needs explaining to Nana.
But Nana seems to suspect you and Sachiko.
Huh?!
I heard her mumbling about Sachiko.
She said something about her working for her Demon Lord or something.
Oh.
You have got it wrong.
That is the virtual Sachiko.
Huh?
What do you mean, virtual Sachiko?
I have no idea.
In fact, I would like to know.
You know, Shoji.
I can perfectly understand that you are exhausted being with Nana,
and you look for comfort through Sachiko.
Comfort?!
That is it, Junko.
That is exactly it.
I feel comfort whenever I am with Sachiko.
But you knew that Nana's an exhausting woman in that way,
and still you went after her.
So do not run away now.
Stick with her diligently!
Of course, that is what I intend to do!
I am committed in this relationship enough to make Nana my wife.
Eventually I want to share a grave with her.
You are taking this too far.
You will never rest in peace
if you die with that believer of the Demon Lord.
Junko!
Whose side are you on?!
Neither, really.
You could say, I am on the side of justice.
What does she mean, justice!
She is making fun of me.
This coming from a former delinquent.
One day I am going to show everyone pictures of you from junior high.
Why are you here?!
Shoji.
Thank goodness.
I was looking for you.
Here is the book I borrowed.
I wanted to hurry and return it to you.
Thank you very much.
Ooh.
Anytime would have been fine.
You could have even given it to me at work.
You are right.
I am sorry.
No, there is no need to apologize.
So, how long have you been standing here?
I am sorry!
I did not mean to eavesdrop,
but given the content of the conversation, I just froze.
Never mind that!
How long have you been here?!
Of course she is hurt!
Sachiko's in love with you, right?
Shoji!
I am sorry.
Are you all right?
Ahh, yeah.
Just so we are clear,
I did not stumble like that to try and make you laugh or anything.
I am really sorry.
No, Sach... you do not hafta apologize.
I am the one at fault.
I am at fault!
Bye!
This is bad.
This is worse than bad.
What am I going to do?
I hafta think this through seriously.
If you keep spending time with her,
you will continue hurting her until it becomes unbearable.
But it would be cowardly
to run away from it like this, right, Koichi Sato?!
Huh?
Nothing.
I am talking to myself.
What do you mean?
After calling a person by his full name.
Besides, Shoji, I thought you had class today.
If you are already cutting class
to come here and drink at this early hour,
I would say your future is not looking too good.
That is right.
What am I doing here at Jackson's?
I see.
So this is what escaping from one's troubles is like.
Then I am already running away.
So Sachiko's more important to you than Nana.
You are wrong!
Koichi
Sato, I am going to work!
I am going to break ties with her!
I do what I can to be buried in the same grave with Nana!
Ever since I first met her,
I was planning not to hang out with her much.
So what am I doing, feeling comforted by her?
That is exactly what the Demon Lord wants.
It will not happen.
I definitely will not betray Nana.
Why do you change into your sneakers, Miss Kawamura?
Because I have to run for the last train.
Right, that makes sense.
Sorry to keep you.
Let us hurry.
Wait, Sachiko!
I have to talk to you about something.
Do not make such a face.
I will not look at her face.
I will talk as we walk, so will you please listen?
If we miss the last train, I will pay for a taxi.
So, how am I supposed to end this?
What am I to tell her?
How?
She is my friend and not my girlfriend to start with.
So asking her to break up with me would be odd.
Do I say we are no longer friends?
But why should I have to say that?
Sachiko has not done anything wrong.
Or rather, she is a really great girl.
What am I doing?
Anyway, I must say something.
You know!
Sorry.
I am really sorry.
You have done nothing wrong, Shoji.
I jumped to conclusions on my own and got carried away.
I will be careful not to interfere.
I will never interfere in your relationship with your girlfriend.
So... please.
Cannot we at least be friends?
Do not ask me to end this.
That is strange.
Huh?
Shoji should be done with work,
but I get his answering service.
I wonder if he forgot to switch it on.
I want to hurry and tell him that I got a new job.
He is probably cheating on you.
Shoji would not do such a thing!
I will send him an email.
I wonder what kind of company would hire a woman like you?
They must really be understaffed.
But you know, I will learn the job while doing errands,
and if I am fully capable, they will hire me permanently.
So I will do my best.
Wow.
You seem awfully motivated.
If I work hard I will get a bonus,
which will get me a step closer to buying a detached house with a yard.
A detached house with a yard?
Is that your dream?
Yup!
A great big dream!
Then I will build you a home with the money I get from my songs.
Huh?
But your room will be the doghouse.
If Nana was a guy, she would be the love of my life.
Back then, I often thought that.
However, if that were the case,
I doubt we would have been left with only happy memories.
Because love and pain go hand in hand.
The deeper you fall, the more painful it gets.
I reached into the sky
But I could not reach what I wanted
They grew smaller and disappeared into the sky
Like colorful balloons
I am alone
My hand had no place to go
And gently you took it
Starless night
I will not look back at the shadow of my past
I want to feel your warmth
Tears are falling down
Even if I am unsure I will not let go
Of your hand holding mine
